newsitem.title: USA: Bausch & Lomb and Pfizer settle Visine lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: Bausch & Lomb and Pfizer settle Visine lawsuit.

text.p: Bausch & Lomb said Monday it settled a lawsuit against its competitor Pfizer Inc. after the pharmaceutical company agreed to take advertisements for its Visine eye care product off the air.
Bausch & Lomb said it filed a lawsuit against Pfizer on June 4 alleging "false and misleading advertising" of Visine as the best over-the-counter comprehensive allergy relief agent for the eye.
Under the settlement, New York-based Pfizer admitted no wrongdoing but agreed not to air the television commercial again, Bausch & Lomb said.
Bausch & Lomb, based in Rochester, N.Y., added that no financial payment was involved.
No one was immediately available at Pfizer to comment on the case.
Bausch & Lomb's stock fell 94 cents to $46.94, while Pfizer slid $1.50 to $62.25 on the New York Stock Exchange in late trading.
